caption:
The image you are inquiring about features a mushroom against a delicately blurred, dark backdrop lit by a circular glow reminiscent of moonlight. The mushroom, appearing fragile and slender, has a thin stem that supports an umbrella-like cap. This cap is semi-transparent and softly illuminated from behind, highlighting its gilled structure underneath, which adds a textural contrast to the smooth stem.

The overall scene is captured in low light, emphasizing the mushroom and giving it an ethereal appearance, as if it is the sole subject under a spotlight. The background is dark, enhancing the mushroom's isolation and creating a moody atmosphere. The light source, resembling a lunar body, bathes the scene in soft light, possibly emanating from above or from behind the camera. This artistic use of lighting accentuates the delicate features of the mushroom while contributing to a serene, almost mystical aura surrounding the image.
title: Close-up of a delicate mushroom lit briefly by the sunlight as it passes across the forest floor in a private forest preserve on Green Mountain, Washington. Near Seattle, Washington. From the Environmental Protection Agency's Project DOCUMERICA collection, "In Praise of Forests". For additional images see fiche #s 209, 210, 211, 212, and 213.
